alert.note: Alert for Wheeler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 11:35PM CDT until June 03 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Texas... Sweetwater Creek at Kelton 5N affecting Wheeler County. For the Sweetwater Creek...including Kelton 5N...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Sweetwater Creek at Kelton 5N. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Water overflows both banks. Cattle in flood plain are threatened and should have easy access to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.5 feet Saturday morning. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued at 1130 AM Friday morning. Friday morning at 1145 AM CDT.
